src:
Torrent respon al Constitucional: "No permetrem que entri la censura al Parlament"
El tribunal s'ha reunit d'urgència i ha admès a tràmit l'incident d'execució del govern espanyol contra les últimes resolucions de la mesa del Parlament
05 Nov 2019, 12:04 by Redacció 324
El Tribunal Constitucional ha llançat un nou avís al president del Parlament, Roger Torrent, i a la resta d'integrants de la mesa sobre el risc penal que té el delicte de desobediència si ignoren o eludeixen les seves resolucions.
Torrent ja ha respost, minuts després de saber-se l'acord del Constitucional, i ha reiterat aquest migdia que la mesa del Parlament no pot censurar cap debat.
"Hem dit infinitat de vegades, i ho direm tantes vegades com convingui, que la mesa del Parlament no pot censurar cap debat. La mesa del Parlament de Catalunya no pot limitar de cap manera els temes dels quals vulguin parlar, opinar i votar els grups parlamentaris, perquè són els temes que interessen al conjunt de la ciutadania." "Al Parlament de Catalunya no permetrem que hi entri la censura. El president del Parlament no pot permetre de cap manera que la censura entri per la porta d'aquesta institució. Un cop entra la censura, mai no sabem com i de què podem parlar i com això acaba limitant, acaba esfondrant els pilars del parlamentaris i, per tant, de la democràcia."
L'acord del TC recorda a la presidència i a la mesa de la cambra legislativa catalana "la seva obligació d'impedir o paralitzar qualsevol iniciativa que suposi ignorar" les suspensions acordades prèviament per l'alt tribunal. I també esmenta les "eventuals responsabilitats, inclosa la penal, en què podrien incórrer" Torrent i la mesa si no actuen en aquest sentit.
Aquest tercer avís del Tribunal Costitucional al Parlament arriba després d'admetre a tràmit l'incident d'execució de sentència promogut pel govern espanyol -aprovat dijous passat pel Consell de Ministres- contra les resolucions de la mesa del Parlament del 22 i el 29 d'octubre, que fan referència a la resposta a la sentència del judici per l'1-O i la defensa del dret d'autodeterminació.
Per fer-ho, l'alt tribunal s'ha reunit amb caràcter d'urgència, perquè el ple ordinari del Tribunal Constitucional estava previst per a dimarts que ve, després de les eleccions.
La convocatòria d'aquest ple extraordinari l'ha fet coincidir amb la campanya electoral del 10N, fet que Torrent ha considerat una "absoluta anormalitat". Assegura, a més, que s'ha convocat per "amenaçar de nou la mesa del Parlament i el president d'aquesta institució".
 



 
Torrent considera que la decisió del Constitucional és política, i troba especialment preocupant que "ara, fins i tot, es vol limitar el posicionament polític dels grups parlamentaris".
"No podem parlar de la monarquia? No podem parlar de conceptes dels quals hem parlat moltes altres vegades al Parlament de Catalunya? Respecte al dret a l'autodeterminació, en aquest Parlament, n'hem parlat i hem aprovat resolucions des del 1989."
text:
Torrent responds to the Constitutional: "We will not allow the censorship of Parliament to enter"
The court has met urgently and has admitted to the proceedings the execution incident of the Spanish government against the latest resolutions of the Parliament's table
05 Nov 2019, 12:04 by Editorial 324
The Constitutional Court has sent a new warning to the President of Parliament, Roger Torrent, and to the rest of the members of the panel about the criminal risk that has the crime of disobedience if they ignore or elude their resolutions.
Torrent has already responded, minutes after the agreement of the Constitutional was heard, and he reiterated at noon that the table of the Parliament can not censor any debate.
"We have said countless times, and we will say so many times as appropriate, that the table of the Parliament can not censor any debate. The table of the Parliament of Catalonia can not limit in any way the subjects that they want to speak, say and vote for the groups Parliamentarians, because they are the issues that interest the whole of the citizenship. " "In the Parliament of Catalonia we will not allow censorship to enter. The president of Parliament can not allow in any way that censorship enters the door of this institution. Once censorship enters, we never know how and what we can talk about And as this ends up limiting, it ends up collapsing the pillars of parliamentarians and, therefore, of democracy. "
The agreement of the TC reminds the presidency and the table of the Catalan legislative chamber "its obligation to prevent or paralyze any initiative that supposes to ignore" the suspensions previously agreed by the high court. And also mentions the "possible responsibilities, including the criminal, in which they could incur" Torrent and the table if they do not act in this regard.
This third notice of the Constitutional Court in Parliament comes after admitting to the proceedings the incident of execution of a sentence promoted by the Spanish government - passed last Thursday by the Council of Ministers - against the resolutions of the Parliament's table of 22 and 29 October, which refers to the response to the judgment of the trial by 1-O and the defense of the right of self-determination.
To do so, the High Court has met urgently, because the ordinary Ordinary of the Constitutional Court was scheduled for next Tuesday, after the elections.
The announcement of this extraordinary plenary session has coincided with the electoral campaign of 10N, which Torrent has considered as an "absolute abnormality". He also ensures that he has been summoned to "threaten the Parliament's table and the president of this institution again".





Torrent considers that the decision of the Constitutional is political, and finds particularly worrying that "now, even, it is wanted to limit the political positioning of parliamentary groups."
"We can not speak of the monarchy? We can not speak of concepts that we have spoken many times in the Parliament of Catalonia. Regarding the right to self-determination, in this Parliament, we have spoken and we have adopted resolutions since 1989."
